sentence: For many investors, thinking about stocks to buy is not on the agenda.

Frankly, the red ink that we saw splattered during the last week of February may not be the end of it.
However, keep in mind that black swan events, such as the coronavirus from China, also offer once-in-a-blue-moon discounts.

Hopefully, they will be cleared.
Otherwise, the case for stocks to buy will face turbulence in the coming days.

Put another way, people are not thinking about gadgets and gizmos.

And that sentiment bodes very well for otherwise super-boring Procter & Gamble (NYSE:).

Generally, I pegged Home Depot (NYSE:) as one of the more reliable stocks to buy under any circumstances.

But with the coronavirus, Home Depot Ã¢ÂÂ which admittedly is a boring investment Ã¢ÂÂ got very interesting.
First, the coronavirus was clearly a black swan event for HD stock.

Thus, the present volatility is a long-term discount as this outbreak will eventually fade.
Second, while people are preparing for the virus to ripple across the U.S., Home Depot should see demand ramp up in the nearer term.
As people bunker down, they may need reinforcements.

LetÃ¢ÂÂs face it: this wouldnÃ¢ÂÂt be an authentic gallery from yours truly if I didnÃ¢ÂÂt include some controversial names.
For this list of stocks to buy, IÃ¢ÂÂm going with an old favorite, Sturm Ruger (NYSE:).

Those areas that have a higher proportion of debilitated law enforcement officers are obviously at greater risk; hence the bullish thesis for RGR stock.
But set aside the criminal element.
